column5: And this happens! Kids are so taken when this happens.
The calendar might say spring has arrived but my front lawn sure doesn't look like it LOL
Another week or so Lew, it's coming.
Yeah, I was just joking, I actually worked outside today in shorts & T-shirt
You can come ice fishing for perch in that this weekend Lew.
After all these years you're still trying eh Bud ? hahaha
If it didn't hurt to walk more then 50 feet I'd be super tempted to test this ice on Cooch this saturday.
On that warm day I already put my boat in the water, but then we had another short cold spell.  But not long now!

What a shame. I wouldn't mind a bass boat like that. It's actually worrisome to see this if someone is looking to purchase a boat. That thing could be cleaned up to look like new for some unexpected buyer.
Word is the guy who owned that boat died and the boat was never taken out of the water.
That rumor makes the picture less fun.
Thought I'd mention it before guys start busting balls about leaving a boat in the water during the winter, lol.

Spring means for me to start getting firewood for next year - try to get it early so it has time to dry out over the summer - burned 5 full sized cords this past winter - all out of it now - once that is done then I can concentrate on fishing
Real shame nobody could help the family out and pull those boats but I spose we don't know the whole story.

We always shot for April 1st for our first game of Golf, snow in the shadows of the Pines many times. If I tee up a ball and don't need to wear long John's it's spring. More than a few times we fished open water of the outflow at Nanticoke in March. I don't care what the calendar says if I can fish or golf then and only then it's spring. Or I should say we used to fish and golf. Open water here on Erie a few hundred yards from shore. A week ago it was solid to the horizon. I wonder how many are going through the ice this weekend? Hopefully zero but I doubt it.
I was actually thinking that when I was posting.  There is usually a reason behind everything abnormal.
Back yard still has about a foot here in Ottawa. Shes dropping fast though. Hopefully won't be to long now. Kind of a sad picture with those 2 boats in the water. Neglected one way or another.
Not too much ice left here in KW. Creeks are flowing.
Yeah, I don't know anyone with that much $$$ invested in a boat that would leave it like that for the winter.
Yes, very sad situation. However, I do see boats in driveways left uncovered all winter, which can be just as bad. I shake my head every time I drive by them.
and no spring would be complete without....................

Walked the yard on skunk patrol before letting the dogs out ,  shone the flashlight down at a bare spot and there was dew worms/nightcrawlers out at 5:45 AM, temp was 4.5 C, obviously didn't freeze last night.  update: 3-29 10PM , tons of them out tonite.
Ya, couldn't believe that either until I saw a robbin just a bobbin and crankin on a big dewey this morning.
on my lake if my neighbor died, you be sure as hell id be in there taking his boat out for him. I guess its just not the same on all of our lakes.
